Lovejoy's Statement Read
A statement from Dr. Arthur 0.
Lovejoy, who was unable to attend
the meeting, was read by Mr. Sachs
at the end of the discussion. It summarized his stand, pointing out that
the bill would probably be subject to
political interpretation, and that it
must be judged by the avowed intentions of its proponents to curb freedom of speech.
The resolution adopted at the end
of the meeting reads as follows:
In view of the alarming curtailment
of constitutional rights and liberties
which inevitably follows as a result
of teachers' oath laws and other similar supposedly patriotic legislation,
